page.title: 02The Manor of Winmarleigh
page.content: Although man has been active in the area for thousands of years little is really known of this early history. Winmarleigh-Wunemerleye as it is first recorded in 1200- and Cockerham - Coc- reham in Domesday - are vills of some antiquity. The manor of Winmarleigh was held by {Sir Gilbert Gerard,}Attorney General and Master of the Rolls,in the 16th century.By marriage it passed to the {Spencers}of Ashton,Lancaster and on to the{Stanleys.}The Stanleys had to sell to clear one Lady Derby's debts and it was bought by the{Pattens. The estate has been sold twice since the{Wilson-Pattens}owned it and at present the major landowner is the {Duchy of Lancaster}with something in the region of half the old eatate.The rest is County Council owned(the college) and private farms and houses.
